meanings.definition: A small piece of plastic material used in the manufacturing of plastic products.
meanings.sent1: The factory worker picked up a nurdle to add to the melting pot.
meanings.sent2: The nurdle rolled off the conveyor belt and onto the floor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten batted the nurdle around the room.
meanings.sent4: The nurdle was like a tiny building block in the creation of the toy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful nurdle gleamed under the bright lights of the factory.

meanings.definition: To form into small, rounded shapes.
meanings.sent1: She carefully nurdled the clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent2: The chef nurdled the dough into bite-sized balls for frying.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they nurdled the snow into snowballs.
meanings.sent4: The artist nurdled the paint on the canvas to create a textured effect.
meanings.sent5: He nurdled the playdough into various animal shapes for his little sister.

meanings.definition: To fiddle or play with something in a nervous or idle manner.
meanings.sent1: She nervously nurdled the pen cap during the exam.
meanings.sent2: He nurdled with the remote control while waiting for the movie to start.
meanings.sent3: The toddler nurdled with the buttons on the toy phone.
meanings.sent4: The student nurdled with the edges of the paper during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The cat nurdled with the yarn, creating a tangled mess on the floor.
